text: The Morris Silverman House is a historic house in Helena, Montana, U.S.. It was built in 1890 for Morris Silverman, a Russian Jewish immigrant. His daughter Dorothy, a schoolteacher, lived in the house until 1969. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since June 14, 1982. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Montana Category:Houses completed in 1890 Category:Houses in Lewis and Clark County, Montana Category:Queen Anne architecture in Montana
title: Morris Silverman House
